newsitem.title: KENYA: Kenyan treasury bill rates little changed.
newsitem.headline: Kenyan treasury bill rates little changed.

text.p: Interest rates on government treasury bills were little changed at the Central Bank of Kenya's weekly auction on Thursday, the bank said on Friday.

The bank said it offered an average interest rate of 24.090 percent for its main category 91-day treasury bills compared to 24.388 percent last week and a firmer 15.049 percent interest on 28-day bills from 15.005 the previous week.
No one tendered for 182-day treasury bills which had drawn an average interest rate of 20.070 percent last week.

The bank had offered 9.0 billion shillings of treasury bills which was oversubscribed by 1.259 billion shillings. The bank tendered for another 9.0 billion shillings of treasury bills to be submitted by Thursday next week.
It accepted 14.55 million shillings of 28-day treasury bills and 9.523 billion shillings of 91-day bills.

There were a total of 18 bids for 28-day bills and 398 bids for 91-day bills compared to 12 bids for 28-day treasury bills, 218 bids for 91-day bills and two bids for 182-day bills in the previous week.
The bank does not normally indicate whether it was foreign or domestic investors that bid for the treasury bills.
